document_title: Acute gastritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
For acute gastritis, the doctor may first ask some questions related to symptoms, pain level, medical history... to find out details. Then diagnostic methods will be performed to reach the most accurate conclusions, including:
Complete blood count (CBC) test: Test performed to check overall health.; Breath and saliva tests: Purpose to check for the existence of Helicobacter Pylori bacteria; Stool test: Purpose to check for blood in the stool.; Gastroesophageal endoscopy: Purpose to examine the stomach lining; Stomach tissue biopsy: A small sample of stomach tissue is removed for pathology (examination under a microscope).; X-ray: This method can be performed to check for problems related to the structure of the digestive system.
